SANTIAGO, Chile, April 1 -- The former President, Eduardo Frei Montalva, tonight accused influential groups in Chile's left-wing Government of trying to "install a regime that will make democracy impossible."
WASHINGTON, April 1 -The Treasury announced a new type of borrowing today -- a $1.5-million offering of threemonth certificates to overseas branches of United States banks.

Criticizing the city's jobtraining and addiction services program, a City Council chairman set the date yesterday for long-delayed hearings on official creation of Mayor Lindsay's ninth and last superagency.

Leading brokerage houses began announcing competitive commisssion schedules yesterday in anticipation of Monday's deadline for the implementation of negotiated rates on certain large stock transactions.
Hoist the Flag was resting comfortably and eating his hay in his barn at Belmont Park yesterday, his right hind leg enclosed in a fiberglass cast.

It could have been the end for "All Over," Edward Albee's latest play, after tomorrow night's performance, but an outright gift of $12,500 for operating expenses has saved it from extinction.

In the most furious struggle of a furious series, the New York Knicks again won the game-end battle from the Atlanta Hawks at Madison Square Garden last night, and with a 111-107 decision ended their first-round assignment in the National Basketball Association playoffs, 4 games to 1.

SOUTH ORANGE, N. J. -When the David Brous family and 16 or so relatives gather at the Seder table for the first night of Passover on Friday evening, they will welcome the holiday with a dinner that makes no departure from time-honored tradition -- until dessert.
LONDON, April 2 -- A huge $800-million inflow of foreign exchange in March provided Britain with funds to repay overseas debts and add $122-million to her foreign-exchange reserves besides.

Poindexter on a charge of harboring a fugitive.

JERUSALEM, April 2 -- Israeli policy makers indicated today that they were willing to reach an agreement with the United Arab Republic on the reopening of the Suez Canal, but not along the terms proposed by President Anwar el-Sadat of Egypt.

HARTFORD, April 2 -- Eight insurance industry leaders will meet with the new Republican Governor of Connecticut, Thomas J. Meskill, on Monday to voice a collective protest to the Governor's plan to impose a 7 per cent sales tax on all insurance sold in the state, it was disclosed today.
ALBANY, April 2 -- The Legislature today began consider-of measures aimed at cutting state expenditures for education and removing some of the benefits enjoyed by educators.

The Burroughs Corporation announced yesterday plans to lay off 700 workers at its Plymouth, Mich., plant. The layoffs will take place over the next two months as the plant switches from the assembly of electromechanical products to the assembly of purely electrical products.

WASHINGTON, April 2 -- The Army, defending itself against public outcry against the trial and conviction of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr., said today that it had "a moral and legal obligation" to prosecute him.
MIAMI, April 2 (AP) -- Roy Emerson upset top-seeded John Newcombe, 6-1, 7-5, tonight in a quarter final match of the $50,000 Aventura world tennis classic.

CHICAGO, April 2 -- The largest indoor dog show to be held in America will get under way tomorrow in the International Amphitheatre at the Union Stockyards. Wear of Cecilton, Md., is expected to name her best in show about 7 P.M., New York Time, on Sunday.

The Bush Universal Corporation announced yesterday a net loss of $15,154,000 for 1970. In 1969, the company earned $1,646,000, equal to 66 cents a share.
WASHINGTON, April 2 -- Consumer installment credit expanded at the slow pace of $102-million in February, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.
The first round of the National Basketball Association playoffs are running true to form. All four divisional champions have either won or are leading their respective four-of-seven-game series.

RYE, N. Y., -- The rocky, wooded 2 1/4-acre site on Mead Pond here could hardly be called wilderness. But it's the closest thing to it that Allan and Barbara Anderson figured they would find within commuting distance of New York and at a price ($10,000) they could afford.

The New York Times is considering the sale of one or both of its New York City radio stations, WQXR-AM and WQXR-FM.

SANTIAGO, Chile, April 5 -- The municipal elections yesterday gave President Salvador Allende Gossens a popular mandate to push ahead with his revolutionary Socialist program, but he still must contend with an alert and vocal Opposition.

They are employed to patrol, protect, defend, arbitrate, soothe, cool -- as part of their duty.

WOODBURY, L. I., April 5 -- There's a good deal more to running a benefit theater party than corralling a few friends. The intercollegiate rowing season began last Saturday. Brown lost to Cambridge University in rough water at Miami, with Columbia sixth; Princeton beat Rutgers for the sixth time in a row, and Yale bested Boston University.

DETROIT, April 5 -- The Chrysler Corporation today forecast first-quarter net income of about 10-$million, or 20 cents a share, up from a restated loss of $27.4-million, or 57 cents a share, the year before.

By common consent, Igor Stravinsky was the greatest living composer. He was the last of the heroic group that flourished in the early part of the century -- a group that included such composers as Bela Bartok, Sergei Prokofiev, Arnold Schoenberg, Anton Webern, Ralph Vaughan Williams. All of them helped shape the course of music. But of them all there was, in the period from about 1910 to 1940, no shaper like Stravinsky.

President Allende can take solid satisfaction from the results of Chile's municipal elections. His Popular Unity coalition fell narrowly short of the absolute majority of the vote for which he had hoped, but its showing represented a spectacular gain on his own poll of 36.3 per cent in the Presidential election last September. His Socialist party, well to the left of its Communist. partner, exceeded its previous best by 50 per cent.
